types.name: CountryCode
types.description:
The code designating a country/region, which generally follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 guidelines.
If a territory doesn't have a country code value in the `CountryCode` enum, then it might be considered a subdivision
of another country. For example, the territories associated with Spain are represented by the country code `ES`,
and the territories associated with the United States of America are represented by the country code `US`.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetSelection
types.description:
The lines on the order to which the discount is applied, of the type defined by
the discount application's `targetType`. For example, the value `ENTITLED`, combined with a `targetType` of
`LINE_ITEM`, applies the discount on all line items that are entitled to the discount.
The value `ALL`, combined with a `targetType` of `SHIPPING_LINE`, applies the discount on all shipping lines.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto all the lines.

enumValues.name: ENTITLED
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto only the lines that it's entitled for.

enumValues.name: EXPLICIT
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto explicitly chosen lines.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetType

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto line items.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LINE
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto shipping lines.

args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.description: Best effort conversion of image into content type (SVG -> PNG, Anything -> JPG, Anything -> WEBP are supported).

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The location of the image as a URL.

If no transform options are specified, then the original image will be preserved including any pre-applied transforms.

All transformation options are considered "best-effort". Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

If you need multiple variations of the same image, then you can use [GraphQL aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases).

args.name: transform
args.description: A set of options to transform the original image.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The original width of the image in pixels. Returns `null` if the image isn't hosted by Shopify.

types.name: ImageContentType
types.description: List of supported image content types.

types.name: ImageTransformInput
types.description:
The available options for transforming an image.

All transformation options are considered best effort. Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

inputFields.name: crop
inputFields.description:
The region of the image to remain after cropping.
Must be used in conjunction with the `maxWidth` and/or `maxHeight` fields, where the `maxWidth` and `maxHeight` aren't equal.
The `crop` argument should coincide with the smaller value. A smaller `maxWidth` indicates a `LEFT` or `RIGHT` crop, while
a smaller `maxHeight` indicates a `TOP` or `BOTTOM` crop. For example, `{ maxWidth: 5, maxHeight: 10, crop: LEFT }` will result
in an image with a width of 5 and height of 10, where the right side of the image is removed.

inputFields.name: cropRegion
inputFields.description: Defines an arbitrary cropping region.

inputFields.name: maxHeight
inputFields.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

inputFields.name: maxWidth
inputFields.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

inputFields.name: preferredContentType
inputFields.description:
Convert the source image into the preferred content type.
Supported conversions: `.svg` to `.png`, any file type to `.jpg`, and any file type to `.webp`.

inputFields.name: scale
inputFields.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be within 1..3.

types.name: Market
types.description:
A market, which is a group of one or more regions targeted for international sales.
A market allows configuration of a distinct, localized shopping experience for customers from a specific area of the world.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The short, human-readable unique identifier for the market.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: webPresence
fields.description:
The web presence of the market, defining its SEO strategy. This can be a different domain,
subdomain, or subfolders of the primary domain. Each web presence comprises one or more
language variants. If a market doesn't have its own web presence, then the market is accessible on the
shops primary domain using [country
selectors](https://shopify.dev/themes/internationalization/multiple-currencies-languages#the-country-selector).

types.name: MarketWebPresence
types.description:
The web presence of the market, defining its SEO strategy. This can be a different domain
(e.g. `example.ca`), subdomain (e.g. `ca.example.com`), or subfolders of the primary
domain (e.g. `example.com/en-ca`). Each web presence comprises one or more language
variants. If a market does not have its own web presence, it is accessible on the shops
primary domain via [country
selectors](https://shopify.dev/themes/internationalization/multiple-currencies-languages#the-country-selector).

Note: while the domain/subfolders defined by a markets web presence are not applicable to
custom storefronts, which must manage their own domains and routing, the languages chosen
here do govern [the languages available on the Storefront
API](https://shopify.dev/custom-storefronts/internationalization/multiple-languages) for the countries in
this market.

fields.name: domain
fields.description:
The domain of the web presence.
This field will be null if `subfolderSuffix` isn't null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: rootUrls
fields.description: The list of root URLs for each of the web presences locales.

fields.name: subfolderSuffix
fields.description: The market-specific suffix of the subfolders defined by the web presence. Example: in `/en-us` the subfolder suffix is `us`. This field will be null if `domain` isn't null.

types.name: MarketWebPresenceRootUrl
types.description: The URL for the homepage of the online store in the context of a particular market and a particular locale.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale in which the storefront loads.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the homepage.

types.name: MarketingOptInLevel
types.description:
The possible values for the marketing subscription opt-in level enabled
when the customer consented to receive marketing information.

The levels follow the M3AAWG best practices guideline
[document](https://www.m3aawg.org/sites/maawg/files/news/M3AAWG_Senders_BCP_Ver3-2015-02.pdf).

enumValues.name: CONFIRMED_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
The customer gets a confirmation and needs to
perform an intermediate step before getting marketing information after providing their information.

enumValues.name: SINGLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
The customer gets marketing information without any
intermediate steps after providing their information.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The customer gets marketing information, but the opt-in method is unknown.

Otherwise any transformations which an image type doesn't support will be ignored.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: preferredContentType
args.description: Best effort conversion of image into content type (SVG -> PNG, Anything -> JPG, Anything -> WEBP are supported).

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The location of the image as a URL.

If no transform options are specified, then the original image will be preserved including any pre-applied transforms.

All transformation options are considered "best-effort". Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

If you need multiple variations of the same image, then you can use [GraphQL aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases).

args.name: transform
args.description: A set of options to transform the original image.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The original width of the image in pixels. Returns `null` if the image isn't hosted by Shopify.

fields.name: uiExtensionMetafields
fields.description:
Public metafields for Shop, Order, Customer, Company, CompanyLocation, Product, and ProductVariant.
Shop metafields are always fetched if there is a match for the given namespace and key pairs.
Product and ProductVariant are only fetched if resource_ids are provided and there is a match for the
namespace and key. Either filters or extensionIds is needed. If both are provided, filters will be used.
This is restricted to development shops for local UI extension development purposes only.

args.name: extensionIds
args.description: The UI extension IDs for which metafields will be fetched.

args.name: filters
args.description: Filters to scope down the metafields.

args.name: orderId
args.description:
The order id for which metafield resource metafield owners are fetched. The resources are the Order,
Product, ProductVariant, Customer, Company, and Company Location.

args.name: resourceIds
args.description:
The resource IDs for which metafields will be fetched. IDs for Order, Product, ProductVariant, Customer,
Company, and Company Location can be provided.

types.description:
A reverse delivery represents a package being sent back by a buyer to a merchant post-fulfillment.

types.name: Sale
types.description:
A record of an individual sale associated with a sales agreement. Every monetary value in an order's sales data is represented in the smallest unit of the currency.
When amounts are divided across multiple line items, such as taxes or order discounts, the amounts might not divide evenly across all of the line items on the order.
To address this, the remaining currency units that couldn't be divided evenly are allocated one at a time, starting with the first line item, until they are all accounted for.
In aggregate, the values sum up correctly. In isolation, one line item might have a different tax or discount amount than another line item of the same price, before taxes and discounts.
This is because the amount could not be divided evenly across the items. The allocation of currency units across line items is immutable. After they are allocated, currency units are never reallocated or redistributed among the line items.

fields.name: totalAmount

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountAfterTaxes
fields.description: The total amount of discounts allocated to the sale after taxes.

fields.name: totalDiscountAmountBeforeTaxes
fields.description: The total discounts allocated to the sale before taxes.

fields.name: totalTaxAmount

types.name: SaleLineType
types.description:
The possible line types of a sale record. A sale can be an adjustment, which occurs when a refund is issued for a line item that is either more or less than the total value of the line item.
Examples include restocking fees and goodwill payments. In such cases, Shopify generates a sales agreement with sale records for each line item that is returned or refunded, and an additional sale record for the adjustment, for example a restocking fee.
The sale records for the returned or refunded items represent the reversal of the original line item sale value. The additional adjustment sale record represents the difference between the original total value of all line items that were refunded, and the actual amount refunded.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT
enumValues.description: A product that was purchased, returned, or exchanged.

enumValues.name: TIP
enumValues.description: A tip given by the customer.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: An unknown sale line type. This represents new types that may be added in future versions.

types.name: SalesAgreement
types.description: A contract between a merchant and a customer to do business. Shopify creates a sales agreement whenever an order is placed, edited, or refunded. A sales agreement has one or more sales records, which provide itemized details about the initial agreement or subsequent changes made to the order. For example, when a customer places an order, Shopify creates the order, generates a sales agreement, and records a sale for each line item purchased in the order. A sale record is specific to a type of order line. Order lines can represent different things such as a purchased product, a tip added by a customer, shipping costs collected at checkout, and more.

fields.name: id

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason the agreement was created.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales associated with the agreement.

types.name: SellingPlanAnchor
types.description: Represents a selling plan policy anchor.

fields.name: cutoffDay
fields.description:
The cutoff day for the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` is MONTHDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

If `type` is YEARDAY, then the value must be `null`.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
The day of the anchor.

If `type` is WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-7. Shopify interprets
the days of the week according to ISO 8601, where 1 is Monday.

If `type` isn't WEEKDAY, then the value must be between 1-31.

fields.name: month
fields.description:
The month of the anchor. If type is different than YEARDAY, then the value must
be `null` or between 1-12.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Represents the anchor type, it can be one one of WEEKDAY, MONTHDAY, YEARDAY.

types.description: Defines the anchor type.

enumValues.name: MONTHDAY
enumValues.description: Represents a day of the month, between 1-31.

enumValues.name: WEEKDAY
enumValues.description: Represents a day of the week, between 1-7.

enumValues.name: YEARDAY
enumValues.description: Represents days of the month and year, month between 1-12, and day between 1-31.

and exchanges.

fields.description: The human-readable payment gateway name suggested to process the transaction.

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The suggested payment gateway used to process the transaction.

fields.name: last4
fields.description: The last four digits of the card used.

fields.name: maximumRefundableSet
fields.description: The available amount to refund on the gateway in shop and presentment currencies. Only available within SuggestedRefund.

Whether the payment provider supports refunds.
If true, then the provider supports refunds.
If false, then the provider doesn't support refunds.

(`johns-apparel.myshopify.com`).

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
